tn.ref: The spirit of God came on Azariah
tn.text: AT: "The spirit of God gave Azariah the ability to prophesy"
(See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: Israel was without the true God
tn.text: Israel had stopped obeying God.
AT: "without a priest able to teach them"
AT: "God responded to the Isrealites' search for Him."

tn.ref: They were broken in pieces, nation against nation, and city against city
tn.text: AT: "They were defeated by other nations and cities"

tn.ref: the prophecy of Oded the prophet
tn.text: Many versions, including the UDB, make this passage read, "the prophecy of Azariah, the son of Oded the prophet." They do this in order to make the sense agree with [[:en:bible:notes:2ch:15:01|15:1]]. Translators will probably want to do the same in their versions.
AT: "removed the idols"

tn.ref: Yahweh his God was with him
tn.text: AT: "Yahweh was helping him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
"They" here refers to the tribes of Judah and Israel that were with Asa.
This is the third month of the Hebrew calendar. It is during the last part of May and the first part of June on Western calendars. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_hebrewmonths]])
See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]]
"700 ... 7,000" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
